articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Refugees from Syria's long civil war were making their way home on Wednesday, as a new interim prime minister said he had been appointed with the backing of the rebels who toppled President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Refugees return to Syria as caretaker prime minister appointed

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli attacks across the Gaza Strip killed at least 33 Palestinians on Wednesday, most of them in an airstrike on a house in Beit Lahiya town in the north of the enclave, medics said.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes kill at least 33 Palestinians in Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: South Korea's police chief became the latest top official to be arrested, Yonhap news agency said on Wednesday, in a widening investigation into President Yoon Suk Yeol's failed martial law that has plunged the country into a constitutional crisis.
articles.title: South Korea police chief arrested as Yoon impeachment looms over failed martial law

articles.author: Ece Toksabay, Mert Ozkan
articles.description: The civil war killed hundreds of thousands of people and drove millions abroad.
articles.title: Syrians head home from Turkey to 'a better life' after rebellion

articles.author: Julien Pretot
articles.description: Amnesty International lashed out at FIFA for awarding Saudi Arabia the organisation of the 2034 men's soccer World Cup, claiming the move would put lives at risk amid criticism of the country's human rights record on Wednesday.
articles.title: Saudi Arabia's human rights record under fire after World Cup bid win

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken will testify to a Republican-led House of Representatives committee on Wednesday on the August 2021 U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan, ending a long dispute with the panel weeks before the end of his term.
articles.title: Blinken to testify in Congress on Afghanistan weeks before his term ends

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz sent a request to parliament on Wednesday to hold a vote of confidence on Dec. 16, setting a path to an early federal election next year after the collapse of his coalition.
articles.title: Germany on path for early election after Scholz requests confidence vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Afghan Taliban's acting minister for refugees, Khalil Rahman Haqqani, has been killed in a blast in the country's capital Kabul, his nephew Anas Haqqani said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Afghan Taliban's minister for refugees killed in Kabul blast, his nephew says

articles.author: Yassin Kombi
articles.description: More than 40 people have been killed over the last week in a flare-up of violence between two feuding communities in western Democratic Republic of Congo, the Congolese army and local authorities said.
articles.title: Communal attacks kill more than 40 people in western DR Congo

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Romania's pro-European parties reached a firm commitment late on Monday to form a governing majority that cordons off the hard right and potentially endorses a single candidate for a re-run of the country's annulled presidential election.
articles.title: Romanian pro-European parties agree to quickly form broad coalition government
